p: Taking the mean expression value of BDNF to be cut-off point, the included samples were divided into BDNF-low and high groups. To identify differentially expressed genes (DEGs) in HD / control and BDNF-low / high cohorts, we computed empirical Bayes moderated t-statistics using lmFit and eBayes functions in limma packages. False discovery rate (FDR)-adjusted P < 0.05 and logarithm fold change (logFC) > 0.15 were considered statistically significant in the analysis of DEGs [ 37, 38].
